desc: Lyric poems -- short, occasional pieces composed in various meters, often concerned with love and longing -- are the focus of this Latin course. Students read the vivacious verse of Catullus, Horace, Tibullus and Ovid and learn to recognize the features that make lyric a distinctive genre of Latin poetry. Prerequisite: Latin 231 or equivalent. GE: FOL-L. Offered every third year.
name: Latin Lyric
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Latin 231 or equivalent. GE: FOL-L. Offered every third year.
title: Latin Lyric Poetry
